comment.path: The absolute path for the pipeline output.
comment.light_mode: Set True if you want to run the pipeline in light mode. Light mode will delete all the unnecessary files and folders while the pipeline is running. (True or False).

comment_1.starting_sample: The sample you wish to start from incase you want to divide the samples into multiple runs.
comment_1.reads_dir: Main directory that has the your samples.
comment_1.read_1_extension: The extension for the first  read. example: _1.fq.gz or _1.fq ..etc .
comment_1.read_2_extension: The extension for the second read. example: _2.fq.gz or _2.fq ..etc .

sample_data.IMP_NOTE: Change the advanced_mode to True and the 3 variables below ONLY if you recieved your fastq files from the sequencer and have a CSV file with your samples.

comment_2.advanced_mode: Advanced mode relies on data just obtained ftom the sequencer and a CSV with sample details. (True or False).
comment_2.main_fastq_dir: Main directory that has the your samples (Advanced mode must be True).
comment_2.sub_fastq_dir: Sub dir that has your fastq files (fq.gz) (Advanced mode must be True)
comment_2.samples_csv_file: A CSV file that has your samples into 4 columns:FCID (flow cell ID), Sample_ID, index, Sample_Name (Advanced mode must be True)

comments.dir: The path for the reference genome directory. NOTE: the directory should have the following files: dbsnp.vcf, reference genome dictionary file, 1000G_phase1.snps.high_confidence.hg38,1000G_omni2.5.hg38.vcf.gz,hapmap_3.3.hg38.vcf.gz
comments.fasta_file: The path for the reference genome fasta file.

comments.annotation_protocols: Protocol set for ANNOVAR to specify database used and the operation depending on the database used.

comments.parabricks: The path for the singularity container sif file for parabricks.
comments.gatk: The path for the singularity container sif file for gatk.

comments.cpu_node: The name of the CPU node used for the analysis.
comments.gpu_node: The name of the GPU node used for the analysis.
comments.fastp_array_job_limit: The array job limit for the Sun Grid Engine for Fastp. Default: 20
comments.parabricks_array_job_limit: The array job limit for the Sun Grid Engine for Parabricks. Default: 2
comments.Pathogenicity_Prediction: Set TRUE to allow the pipline to filter variants based on pathogenicity based on ClinVar & prediction scores (options: True or False). Default: True
comments.Pathogenicity Conditions: Only active if Pathogenicity_Prediction set to True. The minimum number of pathogenicity prediction scores that assign variant as pathogenic during filtration. Default: 5

comments.temp_dir: The path for temp folder used when running parabricks or GATK. PLEASE SEPCIFY A LARGE SPACE FOLDER.
